intro: Mouriri helleri var. samanensis, commonly known as the Samanensis Mouriri, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
